titleStmt.title: H. C. Smith et al. to Beriah Magoffin
CWG9834

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons and Remissions, 1859-1862

body.p: To his excellency, Beriah Magoffin, Governor of the Commonwealth of Kentucky.

We the citizens of Owsley County would represent to your honor that Lindsay Taylor of this (Owsley County) was fined $20 -- for unlawful gaming, by the Owsley Circuit Court, at its October term 1859. We would beg leave to ^represent to^ your honor, that said Taylor is a Farner of this County, in good standing is an industrious and poor man that he does not follow gambling and is a law abiding citizen
Wherefore, we your humble petitioners, would beg leave to petition ^your^ honor to remit so much of said fine as accrues to the Commonwealth of Kentucky, and in duty bound will ever pray &C

H C Smith
Robert Smith
Kenneth Combes
Jacob Hounshell
J P Hampton
E. Hein Esq
A B Hampton
William McGee
Robert McGee
A. A Chastain
David H Bishop
James -- Hacker
C, Combs
Jas Ward
Saml Hunley
J. F. Baker
Henry c moor
J, C, Cole
o. C. Cole
Cornelius Thomas
H C Hargis
Luc y cole
Please remit the fine
G, Adams
Alfred Wilson
T. G Hacker
E, M, Rose:
O, R, Mayers
W Williams
Wm S. Hurst
E. B Treadway S. o. c
Gidion A Chambers
E: W: Smith
James Cole
John W Brandenburgg
amber colle
H B Hampton
A. Bowman
J M Johnson
Robert Wilson
Isaac Hacker
John Hacker
L. L. Manlows
Thos Russell Atty, o c
D B Capps
I hope you will remit this fine

Mr. Linsey Taylor is a clever man as I am informed is not ga a gambler the amt. that He was indict & find for. betting was a trifle it would meet the approbation of the communite if His fine was remitted
